definitions.definition: a device with a small spike or a spiked wheel that is worn on a rider's heel and used for urging a horse forward.
a hard spike on the back of the leg of a cock or male game bird, used in fighting.
a steel point fastened to the leg of a gamecock.
a thing that prompts or encourages someone; an incentive.
examples: profit was both the spur and the reward of enterprise
synonyms: shot in the arm "competition can be a spur"

definitions.definition: a thing that projects or branches off from a main body, in particular.
examples: projection, spike, point; process a spur of bone

definitions.definition: a projection from a mountain or mountain range.
a short branch road or rail line.
a slender tubular projection from the base of a flower, e.g., a honeysuckle or orchid, typically containing nectar.
a short pointed growth or process on a part of the body.
urge (a horse) forward by digging one's spurs into its sides.
examples: she spurred her horse toward the hedge

definitions.definition: give an incentive or encouragement to (someone).
examples: her sons' passion for computer games spurred her on to set up a software store

definitions.definition: cause or promote the development of; stimulate.
examples: governments cut interest rates to spur demand
synonyms: light a fire under "the thought spurred him into action"
